intro: Symplocos guacamayensis, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by birds and mammals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests.
